info.title: FTP
info.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer computer files between a client and server on a computer network. FTP is built on a client-server model architecture and uses separate control and data connections between the client and the server.

post.description: This operation creates a file. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was created, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created file.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the SFTP server after file creation is complete. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

get.description: This operation gets the metadata for a file.

put.description: This operation updates a file. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was updated, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming recently updated file.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is updated. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: SkipDeleteIfFileNotFoundOnServer
parameters.description: Skips the deletion if a file is not found on the server.

patch.description: This operation appends to a file.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is appended. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

post.description: This operation copies a file to an FTP server. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was copied, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Destination file path, including target filename

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is copied. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is renamed. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

get.description: This operation gets the metadata of a file using the file path.
This operation gets the content of a file using the file path.
This operation gets the content of a file.

This operation triggers a flow when a file is added in a folder. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file in the folder you selected.

get.summary: When a file is added or modified
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a file is added or modified in a folder. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. Files larger than 50 megabytes are skipped by the trigger. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: includeFileContent
parameters.description: If set to true, file content will also be retrieved along with the trigger response

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add or change a file in the folder you selected.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return by single trigger run (1-100). Note that 'Split On' setting can force trigger to process each item individually.

get.summary: When a file is added or modified (properties only)
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when one or more files are added or modified in a folder. This trigger will only fetch the file metadata. To get the file content, you can use the "Get file content" operation. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return by single trigger run (1-100). Note that 'Split On' setting can force trigger to process each item individually.

parameters.name: checkBothCreatedAndModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: If the flag is set to true, the trigger will check the file's created date and time and the file's last modified date and time. If the flag is set to false, the trigger will only check the file's last modified date and time.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add or change files in the folder you selected.

post.description: This operation extracts an archive file into a folder (example: .zip).

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination files if set to 'true'

parameters.name: createFolders
parameters.description: Extracts folders from archive if set to 'true'

get.description: This operation gets the list of files and subfolders in a folder.
This operation gets the list of files and subfolders in the root folder.

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

BlobMetadataPage.description: Represents a page of blob metadata.
